item.title: What Is Going On Here? Huge Litter Problem, 20th January
item.description:
This area has STILL not been dealt with. Look at the pictures, its getting worse! Flytips, unemptied bins, overflowing Eurobin, litter lying around etc...There is actually a smell coming off this area now. This is disgusting, why isn't anyone dealing with this??

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Fox on Pavement, 20th January
item.description:
Came across at 5.15 am this morning fox has been knocked over and killed and is now lying on the pavement to the entrance of the Lea Valley Country Park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highbridge Street, Waltham Cross
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins require urgent emtying, 20th January
item.description:
I would just like to make you aware that Southwark Council are failing to empty the bins in the Adams Gardens Estate children's play area and the bins have not been emptied in over 3 months. I would also like to add that this is now starting to become a serious pest control issue and there has been numerous reports of mice and rats in on the estate near bins due to the large amount of rubbish which has not been emptied.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44-87, Hatteraick Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole, 20th January
item.description:
This pothole caused my van to thud loudly and physically shook me and the van. Possibly caused suspension damage I’ll be checking. It’s just as you turn into Northumberland Avenue Barnet from the Great North Road. It’s about 15 inches wide and around 7 inches deep. If a cyclist or motorcyclist goes down this I should imagine there’s a possibility of them coming off their bike.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Great North Road, Whetstone, Chipping Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 20th January
item.description:
I have a two months now as a residents of 23 of Hargood Road keep dumping the rubbish on the pavement, and it is continuously spilling onto my my drive, into the road, and all over the pavement which is making it a health and safety risk to people in the public on the street and also myself. It is disgusting. I have pictures from months ago and I have asked nicely for them to clear the rubbish and no one listens.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hargood Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped sofa on pavement, 20th January
item.description:
Red double sofa has been fly tipped. It is on the pavement propped up against the building so partially blocking the footpath and a risk of falling onto pedestrians.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
